object.course_desc: A course for beginners in Latin, designed to give students a grasp of basic grammatical forms and vocabulary (with reference to English derivatives) through the reading of continuous Latin.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Lectures and practice periods four hours a week.

object.course_desc: A course for students with some previous knowledge of the language: study of grammatical forms and constructions; acquisition of reading skills.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Prerequisite(s): LATN1005 or equivalent.
Lectures and practice periods four hours a week.

object.course_desc: Further study of the language; introduction to the reading of Latin authors.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Precludes additional credit for LATN 2001.
Prerequisite(s): LATN1006 or equivalent.
Tutorials three hours a week.

object.course_desc: Continued study of the language; reading of selected prose and poetry by Latin authors; development of translation skills.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for LATN 2001.
Prerequisite(s): LATN2200 or equivalent.
Tutorials three hours a week.

object.course_desc: Reading and critical discussion of selections from Latin poetry.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): LATN2200, LATN2201 or equivalent.
Tutorials three hours a week.

object.course_desc: Reading and critical discussion of selections from Latin prose.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): LATN2200, LATN2201 or equivalent.
Tutorials three hours a week.
